result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A. Lien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Keith A. Lien
Current: 309 N Cogswell Dr, Silver Lake, WI 53170 United States  (Effective: 08-31-2016)
Prior: 315 N Cogswell Drive, Silver Lake, WI 53170
$831.00 due in 30 days or civil judgment.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Keith A. Lien, appeared with Attorney Michael D. Cicchini.  Clerk: PT
Parties stipulate to revoking the hold open agreement and judgment of Guilty is entered.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs & DNA surcharge and is due in 30 days or Civil Judgment.  Appeal Rights given.
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement - 6 months.
Waiver of Rights

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Michael Cicchini.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Entry of judgment withheld.  Hold Open Agreement for six months.  If successfully completed, State will dismiss the criminal charge and issue a Co. Ordinance citation for Disorderly Conduct and recommend a fine.  Status conf. 7/29/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
No record made.  Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Michael Cicchini.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea and sentencing 1/29/16 at 9:45.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Michael Cicchini.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Based on the argument made in Atty Cicchini's written motion to dismiss, the domestic abuse enhancer is dismissed by the Court on motion of the State.  Atty Cicchini's argument to dismiss the underlying charge of disorderly conduct is heard.  Motion is denied by the Court.  Case remains on for JSH 1/28/16 at 1:00 and JT on 2/1/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss the Complaint filed by Atty Michael Cicchini.  (Hearing 1/15/16 at 11:00 a.m.)
Submitted by Atty Michael Cicchini
for Substitution of Counsel (Atty MIchael Cicchini for Atty James Fields-Bowers)

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved; remains on for jury status hearing 1/28/16 at 1:00 and jury trial 2/1/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Keith A. Lien, appeared with Attorney James LeRoy Fields-Bowers.  Clerk: PT
Atty Fields Bowers states the offer changed and requests additional time to go over the change in offer so case is not yet resolved.  Scheduling Order is given to parties.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:50 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 11-05-2015 10:20 am
FPT rescheduled to 11/5/15 at 10:20 AM pending confirmation from Atty Fields-Bowers
Court has reviewed and approves request for adjournment.
received from Atty Fields-Bowers requesting to reschedule hearing tomorrow as he will be in a jury trial.
James Fields-Bowers

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Keith A. Lien, appeared with Attorney James LeRoy Fields-Bowers.  Clerk: PT
Atty Fields-Bowers states he was just appointed on this case yesterday and requests an adjournment; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 10:10 am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

145pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk NJ  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  PTC on 7/24/15 @ 140pm.  FPT on 9/1/15 @ 840am.  $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/KL (dob 7-25-90)
